page.title: 10Ecology North of Tregony
page.content: {Hedgerows }are along the road at Barteliver nettles are abundant and provide good breeding ground for butterflies.Kestrels were observed on the farmland looking for small mammals in the fields.Two pairs of pheasants were also observed but neither were with chicks (May). In the{Woodland}at Golden Wood partridges and ringed pheasants are kept by the gamekeeper.Golden,Carveth and Pomery wood's are all deciduous.In Golden Wood only a few small birds were observed,possibly because of a resident buzzard.Carveth wood has a high tree canopy where small birds live. On the{Farmland},kestrels are quite common,with the occasional buzzard.In this area farms maintain old hedges instead of fencing,provideing a habitat for mammals.
